title: Phagocytosis Bead Conjugation

source.description: Resuspend beads by briefly vortexing; dispense

Pellet by centrifugation
and remove supernatant by pipette

Resuspend in a total of
consisting of:
- sulfo-NHS
made in
MES (pH 5.0)
- EDC
, made in
MES (pH 5.0)
-
MES (pH 5.0)
Incubate with end-over-end mixing (shielded from light)

Wash by pelleting beads and replacing supernatant with
MES (pH 5.0)

Formulate protein for coupling @ approx.
in
sodium acetate (pH 5.0)

source.body:
n.b.
The large volume used for the step is based on observations that sufficiently high bead concentrations during this step may lead to crosslinking between microspheres (anecdotal)

source.description: Incubate with end-over-end mixing (shielded from light)

Split the
volume into multiple fractions in microcentrifuge tubes (
) in order to centrifuge at a sufficiently high speed
for a total of 3 washes
Resuspend in PBSF
Collect the full volume in the base of the reaction tube by centrifugation
Remove supernatant from each fraction by pipette

Resuspend one fraction in PBSF (ie. 1x PBS +
BSA)
Transfer the entire contents of the first fraction to the second and resuspend; continue through the fractions until as many beads as possible have been collected in a single microcentrifuge tube
Pellet beads via centrifuge
Block via
Make serial dilutions of 1:100, 1:1000, and 1:10,000
Measure concentration by flow cytometry using the fluorescent dye of the microsphere as the trigger condition

source.body: Typical yield is approx. 1 - 2 x 108 beads, or around 25% of the original amount

source.description:
In a non-binding, 96-well plate, formulate serial dilutions of positive and negative control antibodies beginning at
and diluted by 1:3 over an approx. 4 point series
Add 100,000 beads to each well
Incubate with shaking (shielded from light)

Pellet by centrifugation
and remove supernatant by decanting
Resuspend beads in fluorescent secondary

source.body:
n.b.
Make sure that the fluorescent molecule chosen for the secondary does not have spectral overlap with the dye in the microspheres themselves

source.description:
Resuspend beads in PBST (ie. 1x PBS +
Tween20)
for a total of 2 washes

Pellet by centrifugation
and remove supernatant by decanting

Resuspend beads in PBST (ie. 1x PBS +
Tween20)
Incubate with shaking (shielded from light)

Pellet by centrifugation
and remove supernatant by decanting
Resuspend beads in 1x PBS
Measure fluorescent intensity by flow cytometry

Calculate the beads / mL from the percent solids as follows:
(6W x 1012) / (ρ x π x φ3)
W = grams solid per mL
ρ = density (g/mL)
φ = particle diameter (µm)
polystyrene density = 1.055 /mL
Resuspend beads by briefly vortexing; dispense

Collect beads by pulse centrifugation
and place in magnetic microcentrifuge rack (shielded from light)

source.body:
n.b.
It can be helpful to partially open the tubes before placing them in the magnetic rack so that they can be opened all the way after incubation without disturbing the beads more than necessary

source.description:
Formulate protein for coupling @ approx.
in 1x PBS

Wash by removing
of supernatant and replacing with
of 1x PBS; pulse vortex to mix and resuspend beads

source.body: This introduces a 10 µL excess that will protect against bead aspiration throughout the remainder of the protocol where equal volumes will be removed and added

)

Remove supernatant and replace with PBS-TBN

source.body:
n.b.
Whenever volume of supernatant exceeds 200 µL, use a P200 pipette multiple times - the opening of a P1000 will aspirate too many beads

description: Protocols for the amine coupling of microspheres
